title: Will the U.S. Consumer Keep Holding On?
text:
There are plenty of worrying signals about the health of the U.S. economy, from the inverted yield curve to the accelerating downturn in manufacturing. So far, however, the American consumer has ignored all of this. Even as corporate profits and capital spending contract, strong wage growth has supported household spending.

The question is whether this disconnect will continue. On Friday morning, the Commerce Department will provide some answers with its latest update of retail and food service spending. Healthy consumption...
description: Friday’s retail-sales report will indicate whether troubles in manufacturing have spread to the rest of the economy, helping to inform the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate path.
